content: so in the first row you will need to make a treble in each of the underarm chains do not work over them as we need the other side for the sleeves work enough row until it is the desired length you can now either fasten o cid 431 and leave the bottom as is work a row of double_crochet around or make some ribbing in the same way that we made the neck ribbing sleeves https //youtu be/urlpuw1tteo rejoin the yarn in the middle of the chains under the arm these won t look like chains anymore as you ve already worked the first round on the body into them but we will need to work the other loop s of the chains to pick up the stitches for the sleeves work trebles in each of the chains and stitches when you get to the end of the chains you should see a treble that is on it s side the joining treble from making the body you may wish to make a couple of trebles into this stitch and there will be another one on the other side of the arm you can either keep working in rounds and keep the sleeves wide or make regular decreases under the arm to taper it down this is a free patten written by unwind with us and must not be sold please feel free to sell your makes but credit us on your makes and any social media posts for example - i made a decreases as follows version 1 - decrease at the start of the row and end of the same row for row 2 4 6 8 10 20 22 24 26 i made 40 row in total version 2 decrease one stitch every row - first stich one row and last stitch next for the full length of the sleeve make sure you make a note of what you do on the first sleeve as you want be able to replicate it on the second sleeve finish the sleeve with double_crochet or ribbing as desired at this point you can sew in all your ends there shouldn t be many and block it ready to wear please share all your funky anything goes jumpers and tag us in any social media posts cid 2488 cid 2489 cid 2490 cid 2491  https //www facebook com/unwindwithus co uk  https //www instagram com/unwindwithus co uk/  ravelry -
